page.title: 13BEE KEEPING IN WIS. GREEN
page.content: Bee keeping is done in many places in Wisborough Green. My dad is a beekeeper and I sometimes help him. When you are handling bees, you need to wear the correct protective clothing: hat, veil, gloves and wellington boots. Bees are kept in hives which are usually painted white. In one hive there are usually over five thousand bees. The queen is recognised by her size and some people mark her with a spot of paint. In a hive there is a broad box where the bees are born. A good queen lays one thousand eggs a day, if not more. The drones are the same size but do not do much apart from eat honey and mate with any new queen.
